  // Apply a logarithmic scale to frequency and a square-root scale to object size for improved discrimination of long-lived, medium-size objects
  double calculate_priority(uint64_t freq, uint64_t size) {
    if (size == 0) {
      return pri_last_evict + std::log2(freq+1) * 2.0e5;
    }
    // Scaling factors: log2 for freq, sqrt for size, keep 2.0e5 as main scale
    return pri_last_evict + std::log2(freq+1) * 2.0e5 / std::sqrt((double)size);
  }

  void insert(obj_id_t obj_id, uint64_t obj_size) {
    if (cache_objects.count(obj_id)) {
      find(obj_id);
      return;
    }

    CacheObject new_obj;
    new_obj.size = obj_size;
    new_obj.frequency = 1;

    // Use current pri_last_evict for new insertions, but for large objects, boost their initial frequency for fairness
    uint64_t adj_freq = new_obj.frequency;
    if (obj_size > 1024 * 1024) adj_freq += 2; // Simple bonus for large objects (e.g., >1MB)
    double pri = calculate_priority(adj_freq, new_obj.size);
    PQNode new_node(pri, ++request_counter, obj_id);
    auto [set_iter, inserted] = priority_queue.insert(new_node);

    new_obj.pq_iterator = set_iter;
    cache_objects[obj_id] = new_obj;
  }
=======
  void insert(obj_id_t obj_id, uint64_t obj_size) {
    if (cache_objects.count(obj_id)) {
      find(obj_id);
      return;
    }

    CacheObject new_obj;
    new_obj.size = obj_size;
    new_obj.frequency = 1;

    // On insertion, give a slight frequency bonus for objects <= 4KB to aid small-but-frequently-used objects
    uint64_t adj_freq = new_obj.frequency;
    if (obj_size <= 4096) adj_freq += 2; // bonus for small objects (<=4KB)
    double pri = calculate_priority(adj_freq, new_obj.size);
    PQNode new_node(pri, ++request_counter, obj_id);
    auto [set_iter, inserted] = priority_queue.insert(new_node);

    new_obj.pq_iterator = set_iter;
    cache_objects[obj_id] = new_obj;
  }
